pages.text: My drill will pierce the Bedrock!

The handheld, diesel-powered drill is a big advancement in mining. With exchangeable drill heads and upgrades, its properties are almost entirely modifiable. To modify it, place it in an $(l:patchouli:overview/workbench_and_blueprints)Engineer's Workbench$().
The drill runs off of $(l:patchouli:heavy/refinery)Biodiesel$() and can be filled directly in the refinery.

The $(#007500)Drill Head$() determines the base $(#007500)mining level$(), $(#007500)speed$(), and $(#007500)size$(), as well as the $(#007500)attack damage$(). As you dig blocks, the drill head takes damage, but it can be repaired in an anvil.
As the drill is powered by a combustion engine, it will not run underwater unless you equip it with the $(#007500)Pressurized Air Tank Upgrade$().
In addition, with this upgrade equipped, it will not only run while submerged, but also ignore the slowdown usually experienced when digging in water.

pages.title: Lubrication System
pages.text: The $(#007500)Advanced Lubrication System$() applied additional lubricant to the drill at a regular basis, decreasing the durability loss of the drill head.

By adding $(#007500)Additional Augers$() to the drill, its destructive potential is increased, increasing its damage against living creatures and allowing it to run and dig faster. The upgrade stacks up to three times.
The $(#007500)Large Fuel Tank$() allows the drill to store more fuel internally, extending the time you can use it before refilling.
